text: Yeaseen's work on transpiler fuzzing featured by the Go2Hx dev community!
Three new papers by Gabe, Yeaseen, and Zao are all accepted to FSE'26!
Stefan's NSF Trusted CI webinar on automatic harnessing is now online!
Our source-to-source transpiler fuzzing framework TeTRIS is now available.
Our GUI fuzzing framework GUIFuzz++ is now available and integrated in AFL++.
Yeaseen's work on source-to-source transpiler fuzzing is accepted to ACSAC'25!
Dillon and Tanner's work on GUI fuzzing is accepted to ASE'25!
Our binary decompiler fuzzing framework Bin2Wrong is now available.
Zao's work on multi-dimensional decompiler fuzzing is accepted to ATC'25!
Our work on wild API recovery for fuzzing harnesses is accepted to ISSTA'25!
Our automated fuzzing harness generator OGHarn is now available.
Gabe's paper on automated fuzzing harness generation is accepted to ICSE'25!
Our work on kernel configuration tuning for fuzzing is accepted to ICSE'25!
Zao's decompiler fuzzing work is featured in a Binary Ninja blog post.
Our paper on Windows fuzzing snapshotting is accepted to USENIX'23!
Our paper on profile-guided fuzzing optimizations is accepted to CCS'23!
Stefan's ACM Queue article The Fun in Fuzzing is now available.
Our directed fuzzing optimization work SieveFuzz is accepted to ACSAC'22!
